text: <@U7SL518D6> thanks for taking a look. I could have done better explaining the end goal here. I updated the information with the right changes added. Just stuck on one part.Can you take a look?
is there any way to force the JS generated on modules moved to the footer? or add `defer` or `async` to the tag?

thanks for the trick!
so JS & CSS tabs become useless :sweat_smile:
Yeah, honestly though it feels as if the CSS and JS window is wrapped up with these tags :thinking_face:

Cache issue here:
could <@U6GNQ7JBU> or <@U6TBZ66FN> (or someone else) take a look for a CSS file that is not being cached, please?
ha! that makes sense
Sure. Which CSS on which page?
PM
FYI -> <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CEQQ9NFK2/p1549477181085800>

Could we possibly separate the settings for "add closing tag when you write an opening one" and "finish the closing tag when you write `</`"? I hate the former but love the latter and right now they both seem to be controlled by the "auto close tags" toggle
Not to complain, this is awesome

Team, I am new to HubSpot CRM and would like to know if any designer or developer have used any Google material design library or themes on the pages they have built. Asking since we are using Google material design library for our B2B web apps and pages and would like to know if that is supported in HubSpot design manager via some plugin or themes already available?
made me lol

I have noticed with `hsDebug=true` that on my main portal I have a heavy rewriteUrl process like over 170ms.
Is it related to mapping tools <@U22PJPGK0>?
That’s a lot. Is this a page with a lot of links? Is it in multiple languages? <@U6TBZ66FN>
its in 3 langs, but I don't think its that big
Can you share the URL?
<https://www.leadstreet.be/en>
Yes, it seems too long 146ms for me. Let me check.  FYI, you have some error: `TemplateError`

just warnings right?
Those are related to properties that "doesn't" exists inside loops
The page is cached though, so the link rewriting time doesn’t really matter
If you `Enable Language Specific Redirects`, the lang rewriting will be much faster.
`<https://app.HubSpot.com/settings/369261/marketing/domains/languageSettings>`
that will actually add redirects instead of resolving the page paths to the same page in the other language, but the effect is the same
Tagging <@U2PE56HCZ> (I don't manage them). Thanks!
